instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Anyone know where I can get one of these?
threads.message: Is there any place to buy the connectors for MBP-Retina IO boards?.... Search just comes up with cables.

threads.title: Anyone know where I can get one of these?
threads.message: rip it off a dead one. flux and heat the bottom of the board until you can smack the connector off with tweezers.

threads.title: Anyone know where I can get one of these?
threads.message: Or if you're evil you can solder the cable to the board...

threads.title: Anyone know where I can get one of these?
threads.message: If this is the one on the IO board you just go and buy an IO board. If it's the one on the board you need a scrap board.

threads.title: Anyone know where I can get one of these?
threads.message:
No Title

Exacto knife and soldered plastic and she works :)

threads.title: Anyone know where I can get one of these?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 5390"]If this is the one on the IO board you just go and buy an IO board. If it's the one on the board you need a scrap board.[/QUOTE]

No it's the one on the logic board and I got creative with the soldering iron and a knife LOL..... done the F* job though

threads.title: Anyone know where I can get one of these?
threads.message: I would also like to add that these connectors are the same crappy plastic used on $2 electronics project boxes from ebay... WTF
